intro: Selliguea scolopendrina, commonly known as the zigzag moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, undulating growth pattern and bright green, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has a simple, thalloid structure with a central stalk and branching leaves. Selliguea scolopendrina is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in maintaining soil moisture and supporting microbial life.
